title: Iridium and Qualcomm to bring satellite connectivity to smartphones this year
summary: Iridium unveiled chip maker Qualcomm Jan. 5 as the partner behind plans to connect smartphones to its satellite constellation this year.

title: Astronomers witness unprecedented corona formation, evolution around black hole
summary: With help from NASA’s Nuclear Spectroscopic Telescopic Array (NuSTAR) X-ray telescope, a group of researchers recently bore unusually close witness to the formation and evolution of an unexpected corona around a supermassive black hole as it destroyed a star that had passed too close to it.

title: Virgin Orbit preparing for first U.K. launch
summary: After technical and licensing delays, Virgin Orbit is gearing up for its first launch from the United Kingdom as soon as Jan. 9.

title: Impulse Space announces first orbital transfer vehicle mission
summary: Impulse Space announced Jan. 4 it will launch its first orbital transfer vehicle late this year on a SpaceX rideshare mission.

title: NorthStar raises $35 million for debris-tracking satellites
summary: Canada’s NorthStar Earth and Space said Jan. 5 it has raised $35 million ahead of plans to deploy its first three satellites this year for tracking objects in orbit.

title: Airbus joins Starlab commercial space station project
summary: Airbus Defence and Space is joining a commercial space station project led by Voyager Space, a move that could potentially make it easier for European governments to use the station after the retirement of the International Space Station.

title: Raytheon selects Lockheed Martin bus for U.S. Space Force missile-tracking satellite
summary: Raytheon Intelligence & Space announced Jan. 4 it selected a Lockheed Martin bus to build a missile-tracking satellite for the U.S. Space Force.

title: So long, Richard Shelby, and thanks for all the pork
summary: As Richard Shelby steps down, will Washington replace Alabama in prominence?

title: Bootcamp to help space startups clear regulatory hurdles
summary: The first bootcamp aimed at helping startups navigate the space sector’s complex regulatory landscape is coming to New Mexico.

title: China is expanding its Wenchang spaceport to host commercial and crewed moon launches
summary: China is aiming to expand the use of its coastal Wenchang spaceport to both allow a greater overall launch rate and establish new facilities needed for crewed lunar missions.
